pages.title: ⍟ Knight of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Heir of the Wild and Fertility$(br)      ∆ Fire of $(m)∇$() Earth

A knight rides a slow, enduring, heavy horse, to which their own aspect corresponds.$(br)  They exhibit their pentacle, but do not look therein.$(br)  In the background, there is a broad field that has been laboriously ploughed row by row, now barren but ready to be sown after long repetitive work.$(br)  Traditionally the Knight of Pentacles is sometimes thought of as slow and plodding, hardworking and committed to

their humble mission.$(br)  This dedication is often in conflict with the harsh, unyielding realities of life, such as disease, poverty, loss, or simply nature itself.$(br)  Even though they know that they may not endure, they will not surrender.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Utility, interest, responsibility.$(br)  Total dedication to a cause, even when the cause is impossible or lost.

Can signify someone fighting on against enemies or a sequence of bad luck.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Placidity, discouragement, carelessness.$(br)  Compromise. The ability to look at situations more realistically.
